content.description: Prosecutetion is the best problem on the boulder! Awkwardly start with your hands and feet on the bulge at the bottom of the arete. Use a couple crimps on the East-facing side and a good edge on the left to stand up on the bulge, then get your feet up even higher, and slap for the top.
content.location: On the SE arete of the boulder, start on the 'prominent bulge'.

content.description: Start immediately right of the bulge on the SE arete of the boulder on incut crimps. Ascend the face on more good crimps, and top out straight up. This is reachy!
content.location: Immediately right of the SE arete with the prominent bulge, start on crimps at chest-height.

content.description: Start with your hands (and a left heel) at chest height. Crank up to a bad sloper on the arete, then slap desperately for a jug. It is uncomfortable.
content.protection: A pad if your heel slips.
content.location: Facing the East side of the boulder, climb the right arete.

content.description: Start low on a good rail. Follow the rail up and right, gaining the bulging edge and reaching up for better holds to top out. Avoid the suspect flake with the enticing hold for a safer, harder route.
content.location: Start about 10 feet right of the 'bulge' on the arete, next to the vertical crack bisecting the bottom half of the boulder on the East face.
